title: Woody Cook reunites with dad Fatboy Slim on stage after The Circle
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Woody Cook reunited with dad Fatboy Slim and brought his new pals from The Circle along for one hell of a party.

The 18-year-old finished fifth place on Friday’s live final of the second series, and joined the rest of the gang in having a good old knees up to say goodbye to the experience.

James (who was catfish Sammie on the series), Jack and Beth (who played as Joyce together) and Woody’s bestie Ella hit the town on Saturday night.

Advertisement

Advertisement

DJ Fatboy Slim – aka Norman Cook – brought the gang on stage with him at Bramley Moore Dock in Liverpool, where they were all seen partying the night away.

Proud dad Norman was seen cheering on the gang and bowing down to them as they danced their way into the night.

Their appearance at the gig comes after Woody’s mum Zoe Ball made it to the live show to reunite with him and praise him for his efforts on the show.

Woody came fifth in the final with Paddy Smyth winning the show (Picture: Channel 4)

While he may not have won, Woody admitted to Metro.co.uk that initially both of his parents were fuming he wanted to take part in the show after years of effort hiding him from the limelight.

He told us: ‘They were like “we spent your whole life hiding you from the tabloids and everything like that, and you’re just willing to throw yourself out there, what are you doing?

“We spent the whole time trying to keep yourself under wraps and you’re just about to throw yourself out there, for a reality show?”

What better way to celebrate the show’s end? (Picture: Instagram)

Thankfully it paid off, and viewers fell in love with the happy-go-lucky ‘positive vibes at all times’ student who turned detective in a bid to seek out the catfish among the players (with an actually quite impressive success rate.)

In fact, on the penultimate day in the game, Zoe and Norman Cook – aka DJ Fatboy Slim – appeared in a video together with daughter Nelly to praise him for a job well done.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘When they sent me that video that went “we were..wr…wr…wrooong!” I was like Yes! You were wrong, weren’t you?,’ Woody laughed.

More: The Circle The Circle's Paddy and Tim planning travel spin-off show and we need to make this happen The Circle 2019: are Fatboy Slim and Zoe Ball still married? Woody Cook isn’t planning to chase celebrity stardom after The Circle

However, now that he’s out he’s looking towards a more normal future, starting university this September at Bristol.

Paddy Smyth took home the £70,000 prize from the show, with Tim Wilson taking home £30,000 for being voted Viewers Champion.

The Circle is available to watch on catch-up online on 4OD.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Proud dad Norman Cook - aka Fatboy Slim - cheered on son Woody as The Circle cast joined him on stage in Liverpool.
